title: Ticket #4678: macro_expand() ignores default param values
description:
macro_expand() expands macros in a string, but ignores the param defaults table. Thus, a lookup of "$(LIBEXEC)/condor_history_helper" results in "/condor_history_helper" when LIBEXEC is only defined in the defaults table.

There are two visible errors from this behavior:

  • Shared port doesn't work on Mac OS X when DAEMON_SOCKET_DIR=auto and LOCK is only defined in the defaults table. (only in 8.3.1)
  • Remote condor_history doesn't work when LIBEXEC is only defined in the defaults table. (In 8.1.2 and beyond)

The function can easily be fixed to use the defaults table and recognize subsystem-specific settings. Also, some callers of macro_expand() need to be changed to free the returned string.
